title: Hurst Exponent of the Error Term in the Dirichlet Divisor Problem: High-Precision Numerical Evidence from x ∈ [10³, 10¹⁵]
description:
Python/Numba implementation for computing the Dirichlet divisor summatory error term
Δ(x) = D(x) − x(log x + 2γ − 1) over 6.5 million log-spaced points from x = 10³ to x = 10¹⁵.

Performs robust weighted least-squares regression of log(Var[Δ(x)]) versus log(log x) in sliding windows to estimate the Hurst exponent H of the error term fluctuation. Uses sample-size weighting, HC3-robust standard errors, Breusch–Pagan heteroskedasticity test, and produces high-resolution diagnostic plots (variance scaling, residuals, Q-Q).

Results consistently yield H ≈ 0.251267 ± 0.000133 (95% CI), providing strong numerical evidence on the fractal nature and long-range dependence of the divisor error term.
